pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:0.5.eng: 1. The training rule on the robe season

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:0.6.pli: Ime kho panāyasmanto tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:0.6.eng: Venerables, these thirty rules on relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati gotamake cetiye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Vesālī at the Gotamaka Shrine,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.1.comm: In the heading above, and also in the heading to Bu NP 3:1.1.1 (and also at the end of each of these rules), I translate kathina as “robe season” rather than “robe-making ceremony”, since this is the contextual meaning in these rules. For further discussion of the meaning of kathina, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ ticīvaraṃ anuññātaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.2.eng: he allowed the three robes for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—“bhagavatā ticīvaraṃ anuññātan”ti aññeneva ticīvarena gāmaṃ pavisanti, aññena ticīvarena ārāme acchanti, aññena ticīvarena nahānaṃ otaranti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.3.eng: When they heard about this, the monks from the group of six went to the village in one set of three robes, stayed in the monastery in another set, and went to bathe in yet another set.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six keep extra robes?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.6.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.6.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.7.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.10.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, atirekacīvaraṃ dhāressatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.10.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.12.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.12.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.13.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu atirekacīvaraṃ dhāreyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a monk keeps an extra robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.14.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:1.14.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato ānandassa atirekacīvaraṃ uppannaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards Venerable Ānanda was offered an extra robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.1.1.comm: “Was offered” renders uppanna. This word, which literally means “arisen”, varies slightly in meaning dependent on the context. Often it refers to a requisite that has just been given to the Sangha or an individual monastic. I then render uppanna as “given”. Occasionally however, such as here, this does not fit the context, because Ānanda would have incurred a nissaggiya pācittiya offense had he received the robe. In other words, here uppanna happens first, and only afterwards is the robe given. The meaning, then, must be that Ānanda had been given an offer or a promise of a robe, but had not yet received it. In this sense the robe had “become available” to him. The most common way for a requisite to become available to a monastic is that an offer is made. I translate accordingly. See also DOP for this meaning of uppanna.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.2.pli: Āyasmā ca ānando taṃ cīvaraṃ āyasmato sāriputtassa dātukāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.2.eng: He wanted to give it to Venerable Sāriputta

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.4.eng: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having extra robes, Ānanda thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.11.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.11.eng: He told the Buddha, who said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.12.eng: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.14.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.15.eng: “Monks, you should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.16.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.16.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.17.1.pli: “Niṭṭhitacīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kathine dasāhaparamaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. Taṃ atikkāmayato nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:2.17.1.eng: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe season has ended, a monk should keep an extra robe for ten days at the most. If he keeps it longer than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.2.pli: bhikkhuno cīvaraṃ kataṃ vā hoti naṭṭhaṃ vā vinaṭṭhaṃ vā daḍḍhaṃ vā cīvarāsā vā upacchinnā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.2.eng: the monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth has been lost, destroyed, or burned; or his expectation of receiving further robe-cloth is disappointed.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.2.comm: This refers to robe-cloth received during the robe season. For details see Kd 7:1.7.3–13.2.7. “Finished” refers to the monk either having made a robe or having given up on making a robe.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.4.pli: aṭṭhannaṃ mātikānaṃ aññatarāya mātikāya ubbhataṃ hoti, saṅghena vā antarā ubbhataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.4.eng: it has ended according to one of the eight key phrases or the Sangha has ended it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.4.comm: For an explanation of this, see Kd 7:1.7.3–12.1.37 and Bi Pc 30:1.1.8.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.5.eng: For ten days at the most:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.6.eng: it should be kept ten days at a maximum.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.8.eng: it has not been determined nor assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.8.comm: For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.10.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ, vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.10.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.1.10.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp, see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4, the size referred to here is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For a discussion of sugataṅgula and sugata, see Appendix of Technical Terms. For the rendering of cīvara as “robe-cloth”, see the same appendix.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.1.eng: If he keeps it longer than that, it becomes subject to relinquishment:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.1.comm: At first sight this looks like a phrase from the rule to be defined, but, interestingly, it is not actually identical with the phrasing of the rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.2.eng: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eleventh day.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.2.comm: According to the commentary this means the tenth dawn after one received the robe(-cloth). Sp 1.462: Tattha ekādase aruṇuggamaneti ettha yaṁ divasaṁ cīvaraṁ uppannaṁ tassa yo aruṇo, so uppannadivasanissito, tasmā cīvaruppādadivasaena saddhiṁ ekādase aruṇuggamane nissaggiyaṁ hotīti veditabbaṁ, “In this case ‘at dawn on the eleventh day’: here, the dawn of the day that the robe was given depends on the day of giving, and therefore it is to be understood that it is subject to relinquishment on the eleventh dawn including the day that the robe was given.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.3.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.3.eng: The robe-cloth should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.4.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5.pli: Tena bhikkhunā saṅghaṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.5.eng: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.6.eng: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.7.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.8.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.9.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.10.eng: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.11.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.12.pli: Idaṃ cīvaraṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno nissaggiyaṃ saṅghassa nissaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.12.eng: This robe-cloth, which was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so, has been relinquished to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.13.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ, saṅgho imaṃ cīvaraṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dadeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.13.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should give this robe-cloth back to monk so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.14.pli: Tena bhikkhunā sambahule bhikkhū upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassu vacanīyā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.14.eng: Or: after approaching several monks, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.14.comm: “Several” renders sambahula. See Appendix of Technical Terms for a discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.15.eng: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.17.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.18.eng: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.19.eng: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.20.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask you to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.21.pli: Idaṃ cīvaraṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno nissaggiyaṃ āyasmantānaṃ nissaṭṭhaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.21.eng: This robe-cloth, which was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so, has been relinquished to you.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.22.pli: Yadāyasmantānaṃ pattakallaṃ, āyasmantā imaṃ cīvaraṃ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno dadeyyun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.22.eng: If the venerables are ready, you should give this robe-cloth back to monk so-and-so.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.23.pli: Tena bhikkhunā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā ukkuṭikaṃ nisīditvā añjaliṃ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.23.eng: Or: after approaching a single monk, that monk should arrange his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.24.eng: ‘This robe-cloth, which I have kept over ten days, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.26.eng: After relinquishing it, he should confess the offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.27.eng: The confession should be received by that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.28.eng: The relinquished robe-cloth is then to be given back:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:3.2.29.eng: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.1.eng: If it is more than ten days and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.2.eng: If it is more than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.3.eng: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.4.eng: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.5.eng: If it has not been assigned to another, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.6.eng: If it has not been given away, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.7.eng: If it has not been lost, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.8.eng: If it has not been destroyed, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.9.eng: If it has not been burned, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.10.eng: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.11.pli: Nissaggiyaṃ cīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.11.eng: If he uses robe-cloth that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.12.eng: If it is less than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.13.eng: If it is less than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.14.eng: If it is less than ten days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.16.pli: antodasāhaṃ adhiṭṭheti, vikappeti, vissajjeti, nassati, vinassati, ḍayhati, acchinditvā gaṇhanti, vissāsaṃ gaṇhanti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.16.eng: if within ten days it has been determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, burned, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.16.comm: “Taken on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:4.18.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū nissaṭṭhacīvaraṃ na denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.1.eng: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six did not give back relinquished robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.3.eng: “Monks, relinquished robe-cloth should be given back.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.4.eng: If you don’t give it back, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np1:5.5.eng: The training rule on the robe season, the first, is finished.
